title: Kia Xceed review: a hatchback-cum-crossover for people who want something marginally, imperceptibly different
text:
It’s difficult to get excited about the new Kia Xceed, Korea’s latest hatchback-cum-crossover. Offered as a marginally more macho alternative to the vanilla Ceed, the Xceed is a teensy bit beefier, with a slightly higher driving position and a tweaked front end that will look pretty much the same as any other car to any casual observer.

That’s not to say that it has no positive attributes. Its handling is quite good, especially for a car with raised ride height. The windows in the back are generous, giving passengers a better view and letting plenty of light into the aft cabin. Those rear seats, too, are roomy, with just about enough room for four large adults to ride in comfort, and the upgraded...
description: It’s difficult to get excited about the new Kia Xceed, Korea’s latest hatchback-cum-crossover.
